Being cardiologists, it is of great concern to us whether COVID-19 is more common in patients with pre-existing CVD. Evidence from the previous epidemics suggests that SARS (2002) and MERS (2012) were commonly associated with prior cardiac and cerebrovascular abnormalities. 9, 10, 11 In SARS, DM and CVD were seen in 11%, and 8% of patients, respectively, and the presence of either of them doubled the mortality.
9
,
10 Similarly, in a systematic analysis involving 637 patients with MERS, the prevalence of DM, HTN, CVD, and obesity was 50%, 50%, 30%, and 16%, respectively.
